revised_title: Understanding the Perception of Music: Rhythm and Tonality
tldr: This lecture explores the cognitive processes involved in the perception of music, focusing on the understanding of rhythm and tonality in Western classical music. The author discusses the distinction between a piece of music and its performance, and how listeners interpret rhythmic and tonal relations. A computer program is described that transcribes classical melodies into stave notation, demonstrating the steps by which listeners create a rhythmic and tonal interpretation of a musical piece.
